1124031955996168198.text: Our 2nd #chi2019 paper w/ @KlausGramann investigates how to evaluate the realism in #VR without asking users. We use the brain's event-related potentials (ERPs) to catch mismatches, such as when haptics and visuals are not in sync. https://lab.plopes.org/published/2019-CHI-EEG.pdf …pic.twitter.com/UG13ynrj8L

1124031157052555264.text: We will demo new applications we made for our #chi2019 paper "preemptive action" at #siggraph2019 in LA, e.g., use muscle stimulation (EMS) to photograph this high speed ball flying: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1BT8REEJibM … (and feel like you actually did it! p.s.: you did not, EMS did it.)

1124030419425472513.text: Our first #chi2019 paper asks: can we mitigate agency lost when we are moved by an external force? Together with Jun Nishida and @shn_kasa (@SonyCSL) we found out that it is possible to speed up human reaction time without fully compromising agency! Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1BT8REEJibM …pic.twitter.com/vDYcJToQMz
